org.xlattice.corexml.expr

Class Tokenizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xlattice.corexml.expr.Tokenizer

  • public class Tokenizer
extends java.lang.Object
    Given a string, produce a sequence of XPath tokens.
    Author:
    Jim Dixon

        Create the tokenizer.

    • Method Detail

      • pushback

        public void pushback(Token t)
        Push a token back on the input. Allows a degree of lookahead.

      • getToken

        public Token getToken()
               throws CoreXmlException
        Get the next token. If anything is in the stack (in other words, if tokens have been pushed back), it is used first.
        Throws:
        CoreXmlException

      • getText

        public java.lang.String getText()
        Returns:
        the text being tokenized, for debugging

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        Returns:
        the length of text being tokenized, for debugging

      • getOffset

        public int getOffset()
        Returns:
        the current offset into the text, for debugging

      • getLastToken

        public Token getLastToken()
        Returns:
        the last token returned by the lexer, for debugging
